channel.title: AGF Insights and Market Perspectives
channel.description: Insights provide advisors and investors with relevant, thoughtful and timely insights from AGF’s leading financial minds.

item.title: Almost There
item.description: Outlook: Equity markets are expected to climb higher in 2021 as anticipation of a cyclical upturn in the global economy continues to grow. But the path ahead may be rocky until the pandemic is more firmly under control.

item.title: Asset Class Roundup | Equities
item.description: Outlook: As digitalization grows and reforms take root, equity performance in several EM nations could be driven by far more than the post-pandemic recovery in 2021.

item.title: Asset Class Roundup | Fixed Income
item.description: Outlook: High-yield bonds, convertibles and Emerging Market debt may be areas of opportunities for fixed-income investors in 2021.

item.title: Asset Class Roundup | Currency
item.description: Outlook: Emerging Market currencies should strengthen in 2021, but traditional FX safe havens may end up suffering.

item.title: Asset Class Roundup | Real Assets
item.description: Outlook: Renewable utilities, office real estate and mobility infrastructure are among the real assets positioned to benefit from an economic recovery in 2021.

item.title: Asset Class Roundup | Alternatives
item.description: Outlook: Rates, regulations and restructurings are among the catalysts expected to give the alternative asset class a boost in 2021 and beyond.

item.title: The Necessary Evolution of 60/40
item.description: Outlook: Changing attitudes and various adaptations of 60/40 portfolios over the years and give their take on what asset allocators will need to consider in the future.

item.title: The Consequences of MMT-Lite
item.description: Outlook: As coronavirus cases mount resurgences in several developed countries, more spending is on the way.

item.title: How to Build the (Nearly) Perfect Hedge
item.description: Outlook: The story behind the AGF anti-beta strategy that has been helping protect investors from market meltdowns for a decade.

item.title: The Early Cyclicals
item.description: Outlook: Here are four sectors that may end up playing a more prominent role in portfolios next year.

item.title: The Great Transition
item.description: Outlook: The obligation to build a more sustainable economy has never been greater. Here’s what it means for investors.

item.title: Trading Lessons from a Pandemic
item.description: Outlook: The COVID-19 crisis has reinforced the realities of an ever-changing market environment and the tactics and tools required to ensure each trade is executed in the best possible manner.

item.title: 2020 Year in Review
item.description: Outlook: The U.S. equity market has never spiralled into bear market territory as swiftly as it did in 2020. Nor has it ever recovered as quickly to reach new all-time highs.

item.title: Remembering a Titan
item.description: Blake and Judy Goldring remember their late father, C. Warren Goldring, ahead of his posthumous induction into the Investment Industry Hall of Fame.

item.title: Mid-Year Outlook
item.description: The economic recovery from last year’s pandemic-induced recession gained more steam during the first half of 2021, but given the sheer strength of the rebound in countries like the United States where lockdowns seem like a thing of the past, inflationary fears have now come to the fore and may play the biggest role in determining the outcome of both equity and bond markets going forward.

item.title: The Ultimate AI Arms Dealers
item.description: Geopolitical tensions, global chip shortages and a focus on reshoring production capabilities all point to what we believe to be an attractive investment opportunity in Semiconductor Equipment manufacturers.

item.title: Fundamental Meets Quant – Q&A Roundtable
item.description: A Fundamental Bond Manager and Two Equity Quants Walk Into a Bar. Well, maybe not an actual bar these days, but that hasn’t stopped them from leaning on each other’s expertise over the past year. Here’s how their collaboration is helping dissect the current macro environment and leading to more informed investment decisions across asset classes.

item.title: The New Wave in Global Infrastructure Investing
item.description: Digital and renewable energy infrastructure represent a new wave of structures and systems needed to facilitate an economic future that will become increasingly digital in nature and also more sustainable.

item.title: Subthemes of Sustainable Investing: Sustainable Food and Aquaculture
item.description: The push for a healthier more sustainable food supply is creating new and exciting opportunities to invest in the fish farming industry.

item.title: Subthemes of Sustainable Investing: Electric Vehicles and Autonomous Transportation
item.description: A unique confluence of factors, including regulatory pressure, technological innovation and consumer interest, is helping disrupt the global automaking industry and create new sustainable investment opportunities across its value chain.

item.title: The Importance of Shareholder Engagement in Emerging Markets
item.description: This paper highlights the importance of shareholder engagement in Emerging Markets where environmental, social and governance (ESG) data is sparse. We review third-party ESG rating agencies' role in advancing ESG investing globally but highlight caution in basing investment decisions on ratings alone. We have found limitations and inherent biases behind the analysis and ratings, including the lack of quality ESG data and the comparability between rating agencies. We thus conclude ESG integration with active shareholder engagement is more vital to understanding and analyzing a company’s ESG issues.

item.title: Inflating Expectations - Roundtable
item.description: The U.S. Federal Reserve says it wants to let inflation run “hot.” But will the central bank get the chance to prove it? Members of AGF’s Investment Management Team recently sat down (virtually) to discuss the Fed’s new policy mandate and why differentiating long-term deflationary trends from short-term inflation expectations is critical to investors and their portfolios going forward.

item.title: Earnings Multiples and Stock Market Performance
item.description: Bill DeRoche, Chief Investment Officer and Head of AGFiQ Alternative Strategies, discusses Earnings Multiples and Stock Market Performance

item.title: Infrastructure Strategy Spotlight
item.description: Recent years have seen growing calls around the world for increased investment in infrastructure, as stories of power outages, contaminated water supplies and bridge collapses have been constantly in the headlines. The COVID-19 epidemic has added to this growing sense of urgency, as governments around the world reassess their investment requirements in social infrastructure such as hospitals and enact stimulus measures to kick-start economies brought to a halt by the outbreak.

item.title: ESG 2.0
item.description: Martin Grosskopf, Vice-President and Portfolio Manager, Sustainable Investing, discusses ESG 2.0 – A Post-COVID-19 Roadmap for the Evolution of ESG. A “Gentler Form of Capitalism” and Its Failure to Prioritize .

item.title: Global Sustainable Equity Strategy Spotlight
item.description: The market swings over the past few years have demonstrated the importance of a sustainable investing approach. With the crash and rebound brought on by the pandemic, followed by a sustained bull run, sustainable strategies have showed their value in all market conditions, adding value to investors’ portfolios and demonstrating protection from risk.

item.description: The U.S. election will be the event of the year in 2020, but it’s the economy that will determine the fate of markets.

item.title: MMT = TANSTAAFL
item.description: On the surface, MMTers have hit upon success, but in reality, modern monetary theory is more complex and several constraining factors could rein in its promise over time.

item.description: While there’s reason to be optimistic about an emerging market (EM) rebound in 2019, pinpointing market bottom is often elusive.

item.title: Why the bear market in bonds is getting long in the tooth
item.description: It hasn’t been an easy stretch for fixed income investors, but more than two years into the current bear market for bonds, the worst may soon be over.

item.description: Low volatility and momentum have been two of the best performing factors in most regions around the world.

item.description: Investors should avoid a recession next year, but not the threat of it as higher interest rates and growing geopolitical risk continue to weigh on the global economy and markets in 2019.

item.title: Why low carbon is a low bar for sustainable investors
